metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: CSS Styling Images
Learn how to style images using CSS.
content.html: Learn how to style images using CSS.

content.text: Rounded Images
You can use the border-radius property to create rounded images:
content.html: You can use the border-radius property to create rounded images:

content.code_html:
img {
  border-radius: 8px;
}

img {
  border-radius: 50%;
}

content.text: Also look at the CSS Image Shapes chapter to learn how to shape (clip) images to circles, ellipses and polygons.
content.html: Also look at the CSS Image Shapes chapter to learn how to shape (clip) images to circles, ellipses and polygons.

content.text: Thumbnail Images
Use the border property to create thumbnail images.
content.html: Use the border property to create thumbnail images.

content.text: Thumbnail Image:
content.html: Thumbnail Image:

content.code_html:
img {
  border: 1px solid #ddd;
  border-radius: 4px;
  padding: 5px;
  width: 150px;
}

<img src="paris.jpg" alt="Paris">

content.text: Thumbnail Image as Link:
content.html: Thumbnail Image as Link:

content.code_html:
img {
  border: 1px solid #ddd;
  border-radius: 4px;
  padding: 5px;
  width: 150px;
}

img:hover {
  box-shadow: 0 0 2px 1px rgba(0, 140, 186, 0.5);
}

<a href="paris.jpg">
  <img src="paris.jpg" alt="Paris">
</a>

content.text: Responsive Images
Responsive images will automatically adjust to fit the size of the screen.
content.html: Responsive images will automatically adjust to fit the size of the screen.

content.text: Resize the browser window to see the effect:
content.html: Resize the browser window to see the effect:

content.text: If you want an image to scale down if it has to, but never scale up to be larger than its original size, add the following:
content.html: If you want an image to scale down if it has to, but never scale up to be larger than its original size, add the following:

content.code_html:
img {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}

content.text: Tip: Read more about Responsive Web Design in our CSS RWD Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: Read more about Responsive Web Design in our CSS RWD Tutorial.

content.text: Transparent Image
The opacity property can take a value from 0.0 - 1.0. The lower value, the more transparent:
content.html: The opacity property can take a value from 0.0 - 1.0. The lower value, the more transparent:

content.text: opacity 0.2
content.html: opacity 0.2

content.text: opacity 0.5
content.html: opacity 0.5

content.text: opacity 1 (default)
content.html:
opacity 1
(default)

content.code_html:
img {
  opacity: 0.5;
}

content.text: Also look at the CSS Image Filters chapter to learn how to use the filter property to add visual effects (like opacity, blur, saturation, etc.) to images.
content.html: Also look at the CSS Image Filters chapter to learn how to use the filter property to add visual effects (like opacity, blur, saturation, etc.) to images.

How to position text in an image:
content.html: How to position text in an image:

content.code_html:
Bottom Left
Top Left
Top Right
Bottom Right
Centered

content.text: Image Hover Overlay
Create an overlay effect on hover:
content.html: Create an overlay effect on hover:

content.code: Example Fade in text: Hello World Try it Yourself »
Example Fade in a box: John Try it Yourself »
Example Slide in (top): Hello World Try it Yourself »
Example Slide in (bottom): Hello World Try it Yourself »
Example Slide in (left): Hello World Try it Yourself »
Example Slide in (right): Hello World Try it Yourself »

content.text: Flip an Image
Move your mouse over the image:
content.html: Move your mouse over the image:

content.code_html:
img:hover {
  transform: scaleX(-1);
}

content.text: Responsive Image Gallery
CSS can be used to create image galleries. This example use media queries to re-arrange the images on different screen sizes. Resize the browser window to see the effect:
content.html: CSS can be used to create image galleries. This example use media queries to re-arrange the images on different screen sizes. Resize the browser window to see the effect:

content.code_html:
.responsive {
  padding: 0 6px;
  float: left;
  width: 24.99999%;
}

@media only screen and (max-width: 700px){
  .responsive {
    width: 49.99999%;
    margin: 6px 0;
  }
}

@media only screen and (max-width: 500px){
  .responsive {
    width: 100%;
  }
}

content.text: Tip: Read more about Responsive Web Design in our CSS RWD Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: Read more about Responsive Web Design in our CSS RWD Tutorial.

content.text: Image Modal (Advanced)
This is an example to demonstrate how CSS and JavaScript can work together.
content.html: This is an example to demonstrate how CSS and JavaScript can work together.

content.text: First, use CSS to create a modal window (dialog box), and hide it by default.
content.html: First, use CSS to create a modal window (dialog box), and hide it by default.

content.text: Then, use a JavaScript to show the modal window and to display the image inside the modal, when a user clicks on the image:
content.html: Then, use a JavaScript to show the modal window and to display the image inside the modal, when a user clicks on the image:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
// Get the image and insert it 
inside the modal - use its "alt" text as a caption
// Get the <span> element that closes the modal

// When the user clicks 
on <span> (x), close the modal

syntax_highlighting.text:
// Get the image and insert it 
inside the modal - use its "alt" text as a caption
// Get the <span> element that closes the modal

// When the user clicks 
on <span> (x), close the modal

content.code_html:
// Get the modal
var modal = document.getElementById('myModal');

// Get the image and insert it inside the modal - use its "alt" text as a caption
var img = document.getElementById('myImg');
var modalImg = document.getElementById("img01");
var captionText = document.getElementById("caption");
img.onclick = function(){
  modal.style.display = "block";
  modalImg.src = this.src;
  captionText.innerHTML = this.alt;
}

// Get the <span> element that closes the modal
var span = document.getElementsByClassName("close")[0];

// When the user clicks on <span> (x), close the modal
span.onclick = function() {
  modal.style.display = "none";
}
